Reviews.Title: Very impressed!
Reviews.Author: Jeff H
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the online reviews of hard drives I was sceptical to say the least on finding an affordable yet durable well made drive. I wondered if when I installed it if I would be the next reviewer leaving a" DOA" review. Fortunately no. I'm not the computer expert but have built a few home systems and was very impressed to say the least at this drive. Fast, quiet, and sturdy drive. Only had it installed a few days and so far not even a hiccup. Will update again in a few months.

Reviews.Title: I wanted an enterprise drive
Reviews.Author: sbscomm
Reviews.Content: This drive was used to replace my existing main drive in my MacPro. I wanted an enterprise drive for that purpose so I cloned it and it works perfectly. The price was great and the drive works flawlessly. I'd do it again.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: Glenn physics
Reviews.Content: I was pleased when I got this drive, it performed as expected. Arrived on time no trouble. I would do business with them again. This drive is a good drive for your operating system, as at 7200 rpm the indexing is fast, excellent performance.

Reviews.Title: awesome little hard drive :)
Reviews.Author: dahrahn
Reviews.Content: What can I say so far so good. I'm using this as my primary hard drive and I have no regrets. Its been awesome so far. Although a little loud when under load but I guess that could be because my computer case is all metal. Get this hard drive you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: kick a#%
Reviews.Author: jeff c
Reviews.Content: WOW!! this hard drive is GREAT! It takes every thing I throw at it. This was a replacement for a seagate 250 gig  7200 rpm 8 mb cache, the difference is like night and day. Glad I UPGRADED.

Reviews.Title: It was good
Reviews.Author: Ev
Reviews.Content: I really like the product. it was a good product and I used it to repair my mom's desktop. I would definitely recommend it to more people when they need to purchase one. For sure I will buy another one for my computer again.

Reviews.Title: Perfect drives for RAID
Reviews.Author: Moto
Reviews.Content: I have eight of these WD RE4 2TB drives in a RAID3 for my video edit suite, and I've been 100% satisfied with them. Best choice for 2TB enterprise drives today!

Reviews.Title: Fast WD drive
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Bought the 500 GB version to replace a 10K Raptor.  So far so good.  The RE4 is near silent and that is a huge contrast to my old Raptor.  I think that is by far the biggest advantage of this drive over the Raptor.  The drive speed is as advertised, getting almost 133 MB/s at the beginning of the drive.  I think the seek time is a bit slower than the old raptor but the overall experience is about the same.  I am running this drive as a standalone unit, not running any RAID.  Hope this drive will hold up as advertised (as a RE4).

Reviews.Title: Fast, cool, and quiet
Reviews.Author: Milton Austin
Reviews.Content: I have these drives in a Synology DS410 NAS.  They run quiet, fast, and cool.  Actually, with the fans on the DS410 set to "cool" operation, the temparature even under full load rarely goes above 90F.  They are quite fast, with me getting 40 MB/s over gigabit ethernet.  And they are quiet.  The only gripe I have is when they are put to sleep they take almost as long as the Windows 7 network timeout to wake back up.  I'd buy these drives again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: Excellence at it's best
Reviews.Author: brUcEg
Reviews.Content: UPDATE: I bought the disks on May 2011. Today, 2 years later (June 2013), they're still rocking the house without a single problem in this 2 years.Today they're 100 dollars cheaper. I would buy them again at original price without thinking about it twice---------------I'm using two of this babies with a Linksys NAS200, Mirroring with Journaling.This is a quiet HardDisk, and so far all good and happy---------------

Reviews.Title: WD RE4 Drives Rock!
Reviews.Author: J. Kinsey "ptchfrk"
Reviews.Content: Western Digital RE4 drives rule the roost. Like the "Energizer Bunny" they just keep going. When utilized as a primary drive the 64MB of cache, along with 7200rpm spin make for very quick boot times. The 5 year warranty's not to shabby either. Enterprise class drives are put together with more spit and glue than your average drive. If your going to take the time and spend the money to build a computer, or simply upgrade your current hard drive(s) it's in your best interest to do it right. Buy the best tools for the job. WD RE4's, of any capacity, make the build, or upgrade, worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: Flawless
Reviews.Author: Oliva "Olly"
Reviews.Content: Installed in my Mac Pro 2008. Cloned my boot drive to it an have been using full time for a week. Drive is silent (really I can't hear anything even if I put my ear to the computer case.) It is faster than the WD Blue that came OE with the Mac. It just works flawlessly. Nothing more to say. Anything different happens I will update my review.

Reviews.Title: Fast and reliability in one
Reviews.Author: Juan A. Pons
Reviews.Content: If your enterprise data is valuable to you, then these are the drives to get. Much more expensive than the consumer versions, but when reliability is a must, these are the drives to get.

Reviews.Title: RE4...
Reviews.Author: Dallas Home IT and SB supporter "Reviews you ...
Reviews.Content: Personally, I bought this drive simply becuase the client wanted the enterprise 5 year warranty.  I didn't use it in a raid application, but am thouroughly pleased with simple IDE usage.  Not even running AHCI on it.  Just keeps it simpler.

Reviews.Title: SO LOUD YOU CAN'T EVEN THINK!
Reviews.Author: Tim K
Reviews.Content: Awful, extremely loud drive- constant grinding noise on every disk access. Instead of using my new hard drive, I ended up listening to it, wondering when it was going to explode. It was so bad, I returned it after less than an hour's use. Packaging is also poor and doesn't protect against bumps and shocks during shipping. I bought a Samsung for half the price and it performed just as well and is whisper quiet.

Reviews.Title: failed after 2 months
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This drive failed after 2 months. I'm so sick of mechanical hard drive failures. I think I may pay the higher price to go SSD and never look back.

Reviews.Title: False Advertising - Beware
Reviews.Author: GetYerGoat "Goat-Link"
Reviews.Content: Fortunately I contacted this seller (Aeon Micro) regarding the wd re4 1tb harddrive listed for 90.50usd . All over this listing it states this drive comes with a 5yr manufacturers warranty. This is FALSE. After several emails back and forth, Aeon Micro had this to say:"Hello,Though these are new/ factory sealed drives, There is only about two years manufacturer warranty remaining on them.Regards,Aeon Micro"This information was brought to my attention 7-23-2013. If you are considering a WD drive with only a 2yr warranty, you may as well save yourself the money and purchase a model such as a WD Caviar Blue which only comes with a 2yr manufacturer warranty. Over half of the warranty for this product (ASIN: B003SANWI6) has passed. I have graciously given this seller 1 star only for the fact they were prompt in replying to my questions. Too bad they weren't more concerned with coming clean up front so buyers knew what they were about to purchase, rather than wasting 2 days emailing back and forth only to get the real story.

Reviews.Title: Very good hard disk
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I purchase it for replacing my old WD 1TB black, and I think it's a good deal:)good performance and very stable with 5-year warranty, fantastic!Besides, the retailer's service is very good!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Chris Koger
Reviews.Content: W D makes good disks and this proves it.  Hard drive has plenty of space and works great in my computer

Reviews.Title: Received Disks with Multiple Model Numbers (one of them is being illegally resold)
Reviews.Author: Jonas Bendsen "i'm trying to help you"
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:  Even beyond the problems listed below, I did not realize that these are only Sata II drives.  Yes, shame on me for not reading the fine print (the information was NOT in the title when I purchased these), but who in the *%&$# is still selling Sata II drives these days?!  That should not be something I need to pay attention to, especially when the EXACT SAME RE4 SATA III DRIVE IS THE SAME PRICE.  So... DO *NOT* BUY THESE DRIVES.  Buy the faster SATA III for the EXACT SAME PRICE.I'm pretty ticked off.  I was sent a resold drive that has NO WARRANTY.It annoys the heck out of me when I order from Amazon, using the same link, but I get two different products (from two different vendors, especially when one of the products is from a SHADY VENDOR SELLING ITEMS THEY SHOULDN'T BE SELLING).Two weeks ago I ordered a 2TB WD enterprise RE4 disk from Amazon.  It was shipped by SERVERTECH INC and the model number on the drive is WD2003FYYS-02W0B1 (this is a valid product with a proper warranty).Two weeks later I ordered the EXACT same drive from the EXACT same link, but it was shipped by Aeon Micro, Inc., and the model number is WD2003FYYS-18W0B0.Not only did the second drive have a different model number, but it DOES NOT have a Western Digital label.  Instead, the label looks more generic and states "Enterprise class certified by Dell."  When I entered the serial number to register on the WD site, the information showed that this drive is a NO WARRANTY drive.  The exact wording from the WD site is: "Product was originally sold to a system manufacturer. Please contact the system manufacturer or the place of purchase for warranty service." I'm ticked off to say the least.I am still giving four stars because these drives are solid and amazing and I believe these reviews should be about the product, not Amazon's failures, but hopefully Amazon works harder to provide the same item instead of switching vendors for the same link every two weeks or so.  If I am given ANY flack about returning this drive to receive a PROPER one, I am going to be REALLY angry.  I will already be out the time taken to ship (and now ship back and receive a new one), not to mention the effort to repackage, go to the shipping facility, and ship the drive back to Amazon.ALWAYS GO TO THE MANUFACTURER'S SITE TO REGISTER YOUR DRIVES IMMEDIATELY UPON RECEIVING THEM. This is the quickest and easiest way to find out if you have been sold a legitimate drive (I wasn't).***UPDATE: It should be noted that Aeon Micro was extremely quick (less than 12 hours) to remedy the situation.  I was sent an RMA and postage paid shipping label, and they actually over-nighted a brand new drive (manufactured in March of this year) with the appropriate WD label even before I returned the drive that had been manufactured for Dell builds and resale.  I'm still not sure why Aeon would ship out drives sold specifically as "system build" drives for Dell (and thus carrying NO warranty from the manufacturer), especially as fulfillment from an Amazon link showing original WD-labeled OEM drives, but they were quick to remedy the problem ONCE I POINTED IT OUT.  I'm not sure every consumer knows to check their drive on the manufacturer's website upon receiving (I only knew because I had read about a similar problem in another Amazon review).  So... the way the problem was handled was *excellent*, but it's still a problem that should never have occurred in the first place.

Reviews.Title: It's a hard drive.
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Lots of space, remembers things. It's a hard drive. 11 more words needed to finish this review. Just three now.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Drive.
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I will only use Enterprise drives in my system any more. I have had too many hard drives fail in the past.. not to say these are bullet proof. But there fail rate is a lot better then regular desktop drives. I use these in my Drobo and in any desktop, Also enterprise drives are a must for any Raid setups especially Raid 1 Mirrors.

Reviews.Title: Room to grow
Reviews.Author: Mitchell A McGinnis
Reviews.Content: Great product. I wasnt looking for SSD speed, so im not dissapointed. I wish the read/write was a bit higher. I never benchmarked it, but for a new HD it doesnt seem a bit faster than my old Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Great Drive
Reviews.Author: Josh90
Reviews.Content: When my rarely-used gaming desktop's hard drive failed after just three years, I was pretty irritated.  I wanted something that was reliable above all, and I wasn't too concerned about speed or noise or much else.  I decided that an enterprise drive with a 5-year warranty would do the trick, and I bought this one.  It's not as fast as the 256GB solid-state drive in my MacBook, but it shouldn't be.  This is easily the fastest mechanical hard drive I have ever used, despite being handicapped with SATA 2.0.  I see this as a bonus, since I was really just looking for reliability.  I bought the 1TB version for about $110, which I think is a pretty good value considering the drive's five-year warranty and performance ambitions.  If you're looking for negatives, the only one I can come up with is noise.  Most drives today are nearly silent--this one is not.  It's definitely not a bad noise, it just reminds me of the way my old desktop from 2005 sounded; just faster and more refined.  I'm not bothered by it, and it certainly deserves all five stars.  With 6GB of RAM and my 2009 Core i7 Quad processor, Windows 8 Pro boots quickly and runs brilliantly.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Rayquaza Ja'darious
Reviews.Content: Fast, reliable drive. Has a large cache and comes from a reputable brand in a reputable country. Eat it seagate

Reviews.Title: Western Digital Enterprise is the best - for a price.
Reviews.Author: larrydd
Reviews.Content: We've been upgrading our systems recently, and have found that spending more for a superior product with a serious warranty is easily worth it. These drives are fast, quiet, and reliable. We've never received a DOA and have never had to look for warranty service.

Reviews.Title: Bought 4, got 4 working
Reviews.Author: Shawn M.
Reviews.Content: Using these with a 3ware 9550SX-12 RAID card, and all 4 are working fine and have been for about a month. The machine is running OpenFiler, and these are acting as storage. No problems here.Note: I learned the hard way that you simply can NOT use WD15EARS drives in RAID or any other non TLER drive from WD anymore. They have gotten wise to us using non enterprise drives and switching TLER through firmware and saving money. Well, not anymore folks... I know that there are reasons behind WD doing this such as the fact that it may be more risky for someone to use a regular hard drive and switch TLER and use it in production and have problems later on.. who knows? Maybe WD is trying to save us from ourselves, haha. I'm sure the increase in enterprise drive sales also doesn't hurt their feelings.No complaints.

Reviews.Title: So far so good, for Win 7 system.
Reviews.Author: sliprocket
Reviews.Content: Had this drive for two months with no problems.  I will order 3 more RE4 drives.Pros:Not DOABios had no problemsWin7 install had no problemsWin7 performance rating of 5.9Cons:None that I can detect at this pointConclusion:Win7 works great on a home built system with this drive.  I need three more but will purchase the 1TB instead of 500GB.

Reviews.Title: Reasonably priced, fast, reliable storage.
Reviews.Author: dave.mack
Reviews.Content: I had been using Seagate 500GB drives for new workstation builds but the price on those drives has remained relatively high while the price on the Western Digital Enterprise-Class 500GB drives has dropped to the point that it's the same price or cheaper for enterprise-class drives compared to desktop-class drives.  While we haven't had any failures in the Seagate 500GB drives (several dozen sold), using enterprise-class drives adds some perceived value and reliability to the workstations.  Theoretically these drives are a little faster than the Seagates too, although I doubt any end user could tell the difference.  The 5-year warranty is nice, too.

Reviews.Title: Good Drive & 5 Year Warranty
Reviews.Author: Snarly
Reviews.Content: I bought this through an "Amazon Fulfilled" site.  I checked the serial number and it shows a 5 year warranty.  The drive works fine.

Reviews.Title: (Hopefully) Reliable Storage
Reviews.Author: M. Hutchens
Reviews.Content: It performs as advertised.  I haven't noticed any major issues with heat or noise.  I'm using this in an external enclosure for moving files and backups.  I've had it about 4 weeks and I've got no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Better than black
Reviews.Author: B. Thorp "Moo"
Reviews.Content: Usuaully I'd be finding myself getting a 320, 640, or 1 or 2TB WD Black drive, however due to the market of drives, this one ended up being the best size for the dollar.  The last time I found myself buying an Enterprise drive was back when they were 80GB -- and that one still runs strong.I was very surprised to how quiet this drive is -- as quiet as a black, however its faster than my preferred drive (WD Black 640GB 64mb SATA6) and doesnt back down under load.This model also has firmware to enhance performance once in a raid, which I plan on doing once its price drops more.

Reviews.Title: Very good service
Reviews.Author: dps_mike
Reviews.Content: Product arrived promptly and was exactly as described and has performed perfectly since being installed. I'm very happy with this item and the quick shipment.

Reviews.Title: Very Fast
Reviews.Author: Stelai
Reviews.Content: I love this drive.  I use it with 3 others in a raid 5 setup.  So far so good.  Runs fast and tsays cool enough they don;t burn my hand.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Schwab "Nomad3"
Reviews.Content: I bought this hard drive to help troubleshoot my parents' computer problems.  I am very happy with this product.  Other reviewers commented that the hard drive was too loud.  However, I don't think it is loud, especially considering the speed.  I recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Review 001
Reviews.Author: Informed Shopper
Reviews.Content: Great Hard Drive.Start up,Over all system response quicker.Replaced older 500 Gb Western Digital drive with 32 meg cache.Packaging Good,Delivered on time.Buy it,it's a Good Product that works.Thank you.

Reviews.Title: All good
Reviews.Author: R. Griffen
Reviews.Content: I will second P. Levine's positive review on the packaging.  Mine was identically packed and included being in a sealed antistatic bag.  Looks like it's not a fluke.  Online vendor packaging is frequently so bad that I believe the 10% plus DOA or early death rate for drives is due to this issue.  Kudos to Amazon.About the drive.  It's fast and very quiet. No issues.  The RE4 is an Enterprise quality drive and per WD, each is burned-in before shipping.  I'm happy to trade a few more bucks to reduce the chance of HD failure.

Reviews.Title: Bought 2: One Was Good, One Was Bad
Reviews.Author: Mountain Bill
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these Western Digital RE4 WD2003FYYS 2 TB 64-meg cache drives for use in a quad-processor desktop PC with a Raid 1 configuration, 4-gigs of memory, running Windows 7 (32-bit).  When the drives arrived, one was working and the other one had numerous bad sector errors (according to WD's drive evaluation DOS utility). Both had been well-packed for shipment: each OEM drive was packed in foam in it's own box, and then each of those boxes were surrounded by bubble-wrap and then packed in another carton. Since these were supposed to have been ultra-reliable "enterprise-class" drives, a failure rate of 50% wasn't what I had expected. RMAed both of the drives and instead bought two WD1002FBYS RE3 1 TB 32-meg cache drives. The RE3 drives have been working fine since installed.On a more positive note, when tested against my 3-year old Hitachi HDP7250GLA 500 GB drives with a 16-meg cache, the WD2003FYYS drives (in a Raid 1 configuration on my system) had a 90% faster average access time (19.8 for the Hitachi HDP7250GLA vs. 10.4 for the WD2003FYYS).  Most of that difference likely due to the 16-meg vs. 64-meg disk cache -- along with improvements in hard drive technology over a period of 3 years. Comparing the RE4 WD2003FYYS to the RE3 WD1002FBYS drives, the WD1002FBYS drives' average access time is about 18% slower -- although still 56% faster than the two older-model Hitachi's that they replaced.

Reviews.Title: High Performance , High Quality
Reviews.Author: PoultryLogistics
Reviews.Content: 29 June, 2011Having hovered on the fringes of 3D CAD long enough, I recently purchased a used Dell Precision T5400 workstation (Xeon quad core 3.16 Ghz, 4GB RAM, 1TB Hitachi, Quadro FX570 video card) to get the best performance I could using AutoCad Revit 2011 and Inventor Pro 2011- both very demanding 3D CAD programs.  I upgraded the T5400 to 12GB RAM, and from Vista Business 64-bit to Windows 7 Ultimate 64-bit, and today I'm adding an NVidia geforce GTX 285 1GB that will configured to emulate a Quadro 5800 CAD oriented card- (and thereby saving about $3,000 on the card). Because I'm not very disciplined with backup and always worried about HD failure- though I've only had 2 failures in 18 years, I decided to set up- eventually -a RAID 1 that would have a pair of HD's that continually mirror each other.Having had good luck with Western Digital drives and read many HD reviews, I chose a Western Digital RE4, 500GB. Another contender was the single platter Samsung 500GB which is also very fast. Early on during research, I was planning to buy a pair of WD Caviar Black 1TB, but WD has arranged that only the Enterprise series can be configured for RAID- some sort of error correction is not present in their other series, so an RE4 it was.  Instead of having to learn how to set up the RAID, for the time being, I decided to take the 1TB Hitachi out of the T5400, mount it in a USB HD enclosure (Sabrent eSATA to SATA aluminum) and for now this external drive would become the backup drive. The external drive will only run when backing up and I'm hoping that will extend it's life substantially.  By the way, the Sabrent aluminum enclosure is brilliant- very nicely made and has a extremely quiet fan which keeps it very cool. The blue lights give it a serious, almost military hardware quality.The Precision T5400 has a wonderfully convenient HD carrier assembly that unclips and swings out and the drives are held in caddies that can be unclipped and draw vertically from the carrier. It's possible to change drives in less than 5 minutes. Having had a disaster while using Paragon Suite 10- during which the 1-year old WD 750BG disk from my XP machine (Dell Dimension 8400) became a door stop, I set the RE4 in the second drive caddy on SATA 1 and cloned the Hitachi (on SATA 0)to the RE4 using Easus ToDo 2.5 which is a free version, and excellent- you can be cloning in minutes. I recommend that anyone contemplating an HD upgrade spend an equal effort in carefully choosing utilities- the software I bought ruined a HD and created many hours of frustration, while the free product sailed through.  When cloning the partitions from the Hitachi to the RE4, the transfer ran initially at 3.87GB/min and at the end, at 3.2GB/sec. In all it copied about 120GB in four partitions in about 29 minutes. I used the Easus to copy a backup of C: to another HD partition in a Dell Optiplex 740 (Athlon 64 dual core 2.4Ghz, Hitachi 500GB) and the transfer rate was about 2.4GB/min- still seeming quite fast.  The 64MB cache of the RE4 is something that improves read/write rates, and that may be a lot of the difference- it really works. Checking at the end of the cloning session, the RE4 was running at 89F and the Hitachi in the enclosure at 110F.  At the moment, the RE4 is at 82F- only 10 degrees above the room.  I was surprised that with the RE4 my Windows Experience index for the T5400 disk remained the same at 5.9, as the startup, application speeds, and transfer times seemed very much improved.The RE4 is very quiet- and the T5400 has a heavy case and cover that probably assists this, and it seems to me to have less vibration than any drive I've had. Looking at it physically, it seems more substantially made, and I can see that the base of the platter spindle is large diameter.  WD touts this extra rotational stability as a reason they can offer a 5- year warranty- and it must be effective. If you are using CAD, a good video card is essential in combination with fast read/write drive speeds. And, if you're on a budget as I am, consider high end gaming cards that use the same GPU as CAD-oriented cards. There are several NVidia geforce cards that can act as extremely expensive Quadros. Wikipedia has a fantastically useful table of quadro cards with notes on which geforce uses the same GPU. You can use a utility to simply rename the card as the CAD version and using the CAD drivers, save, save, save while having very high CAD performance. That's how the GTX285 can emulate a Quadro 5800 costing 10 times as much (note: the 285 is 1GB and the 5800 4GB).  If you use Autodesk products, you can download optimized drivers for their recommended cards. Gaming cards concentrate on fast frame rates- abbreviating shading and rendering while CAD cards shade and render every frame fully. In these applications the combination of fast disk and fast video can transform the 3D CAD use.  Newer software is increasingly taking advantage of multiple cores as well- if you have AutoCad 2007 or newer, type WHIPTHREAD in the command line, choose one of three configurations, and it will optimize core threading.A word about HD size: When contemplating my needs for HD space, I determined that all the files I've created since 1993- excluding many GB's of audio files on my recording computer (HP Elite quad core 3Ghz Q6600, 8GB RAM)- is only about 25GB and that includes 9,000 documents, 600 AutoCad drawings, and 11,000 images. When I set up the Hitachi drive- which was a 1TB,  I created a 100GB partition for the OS and Programs, 100Gb for active files, 100GB for archive files, and the remaining 700GB for a backup copy of C:. Adding it up- 45GB in C:, 22 in D:, 18 in F: and 45 in G:, at this rate I could theoretically use something like a 160GB drive with room for 10 more years of work.  Message- have a look at your real storage needs.  Also, consider a reasonably compact partition for the OS/programs- because the tracking arms then have a shorter distance to travel, the access time is noticeably reduced and of course, partitions are virus resistant.  With the RE4 "short-shifted" in this way, except for the huge 3D applications, starting applications like WordPerfect X4 and Corel Photopaint is more like "snapping" them on- they just appear instantly. I changed the video card in the Optiplex 740 from onboard shared 1GB ATI Radeon 6150LE to a Quadro FX 570 (256MB) and the Windows Index for gaming graphics went from 3.7 to 4.9 and the important for me graphics index from 3.0 to 4.6- a 60% percent improvement. By the way, over the years, Dell computers seem to have a consistently high synergy with NVidia cards.Overall, the Western Digital RE4 500GB, is a very satisfying product that seems a good step above in quality and performs better than any drive I've had. 3D CAD is very read/write intensive and the 64MB cache of the RE4 is surely helping- and can properly support the speeds of a high performance video card.  The RE4 may be the beautiful swan song of mechanical HD's- and my last mechanical HD purchase. When 320GB SSD's are $100,...Summary: The extra cost for the RE4 is one of the best uses for $20 I can think of! Consider carefull, disk utility software, using compact OS/application partitions, and a video card that in combination can utilize the capabilities of the RE4.  Amazon as usual did very well, and the RE4 was sent in a fitted box with formed plastic end holders.Cheers,PoultryLogistics

Reviews.Title: As Advertised
Reviews.Author: J. T. Hicks
Reviews.Content: Just installed it and check enitre disk for errors -- none found -- just what I would expect from a premium-priced hard drive.  If you don't hear back from my it is safe to assume it is continuing to work well.

Reviews.Title: Western Digital Hard Drives Have Always Been Reliable In My Computers
Reviews.Author: Welford Hester
Reviews.Content: This hard drive has run beautifully so far. It has mate all of my expectations.I would recommend this internal hard drive.

Reviews.Title: 33.3% Failure Rate
Reviews.Author: Gene P. Louie
Reviews.Content: Here are the positives and negatives of this product...ADVANTAGES.1. "Enterprise" means durability. The unit is designed with over engineered and quality parts to cope with the requirements of commercial servers..2. The specs look "state of the art" for hard drives...DISADVANTAGES.1. The unit runs hot. You can feel the heat on the case..2. It is every expensive - almost double the cost of a standard 2TB hard drive on sale at Frys Electronics..The cheapest price for this model in the U.S. is sold by GoHardDrive, an online store on the Ebay website. I purchased three at $84.95 each. The original asking price was $89.95, but I was able to negotiate a $5 discount..The shipping was free, and there was no sales tax. The package arrived fast - within three days by USPS..3. Western Digital does not provide any software to format and partition the hard drive. The manufacturer website details the necessary procedure using Windows Drive Tools, which is provided in the operating system. Unfortunately they do not work..As an alternative, I went to the Seagate website and downloaded DiscWizard. This free software was essential in setting the MBR format..Afterwards, I downloaded AOMEI Partition Assistant, a free open source product. This software was used to create the necessary partitions on the drive...--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------..UPDATE.I purchased six drives. Within three months, two went bad. The first could only hold a portion of its rated storage space - it could not store anything beyond 1.2 TB. The second developed a defect on the MBR track. The drive would not boot; it did not show up as a partition in WINDOWS EXPLORER; reformatting the drive did not correct the problem; and resurrecting an image of the boot partition was unsuccessful. A 33.3% failure rate at these prices is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Works wonderfully, but noisy!
Reviews.Author: Michael D. Donahoe
Reviews.Content: I just replaced my Seagate that was failing with this product.  So far I'm happy with the performance, nice response times.  However, I've never heard such a noisy hard drive. This is sort of a pain for me as I do some video / audio recording and editing and this much noise is a problem.All in all, I'd say a great value, and if a chattering hard drive isn't an issue then well worth the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Sweet Deal
Reviews.Author: DMBlueFox
Reviews.Content: Faster than any hard drive I have owned before-I use it for gaming (GTA 4, BF3, SC2, Skyrim, Minesweeper etc)I use it for media- data transfers are a blast- it keeps up pretty good with my SSD that I've got set up for booting.The 1 Terabyte version of the hard drive has been reliable up to now, and it's been about a year- I'm quite pleased with it- felt like leaving mention of it here. Thx, ciao

Reviews.Title: It works good and it's cheap
Reviews.Author: Kirk
Reviews.Content: I like Western digital hard drive because they seem to be more reliable, and quieter than other brands. However, in a 24/7 server I only get about 4 years before failure sometimes 5.  But it is cheap for a lot of storage.  Excellent as a backup drive.

Reviews.Title: work greate for the EMC/Lenovo/Iomega ipx6 nas
Reviews.Author: D. nguyen
Reviews.Content: Got 6 of the drives (5 from Amazon -- due to limit / account) and put in a 6 bay NAS storage (also from Amazon) and I have a decent  NAS of 9+TB (raid5).  If the 3TB Red edition was available, I would get that instead -- but, it was not on sale.

Reviews.Title: Great love it
Reviews.Author: Nathaniel
Reviews.Content: Runs good and faster then my last hard drive maybe just because windows 7 is freshly installed on it as it is a new hard drive and has nothing really stored on it ... Love the Hard Drive Western Digital makes some of the best hard drives with a lower fail rate then most !

Reviews.Title: This hard drive is in reality a Western Digital "Black" 7200 (64MB of cache) SATA hard drive version SATA II.
Reviews.Author: david j gibson
Reviews.Content: For "older" motherboards that support SATA II this hard drive is simply superb. It is indeed a Dell hard drive and Dell calls it an "Enterprise Hard drive". In reality it is really a Western Digital "Black" 7200 hard drive with 64MB of cache, version SATA II. And of course it will work on either SATA I or SATA III motherboards as well. It just happens my new motherboard supported SATA II so this HD is a perfect match.

Reviews.Title: WD RE4 500 GB Enterprise Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: D. Guaetta "Guedo1"
Reviews.Content: I had (2) Seagate Hard drives go out on me within a period of 2 months.  I'm hoping that the Western Digital will surely last me a longer period of time than the Seagate.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Henry Starcher
Reviews.Content: Excellent product. Running fine so far in an old Dell PE1900 server functioning now as a backup domain controller for organization

Reviews.Title: Hard Drives for NetGear NAS Raid
Reviews.Author: BernardC
Reviews.Content: So far, so good! The Hardrives appear to be functioning well. The install was a snap and the drives seem to be compatible with the NetGear NAS Raid

Reviews.Title: 2 of 5 failed
Reviews.Author: Jeromy Leugers
Reviews.Content: I purchased five of these in July of 2012.  One failed on me in November 2012, and RMA went successful.  A second one just failed on me this week (March 2013), so I'm going through the RMA process again.

Reviews.Title: 2 PUCHASED 2 WORKING FINE! GREAT DRIVES!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I PURCHASED 2 OF THE 500GB RE4 DRIVES. ONE FOR ME, ONE FOR CLIENT. BOTH ARE RUNNING PERFECTLY! 5 YEAR WARRANTY IS A PLUS. THANK YOU AMAZON FOR SELLING @ SUCH A BARGAIN. DRIVES BOTH MADE IN MALAYSIA, WHICH IS IMPORTANT TO ME AS AN ENGINEER!

Reviews.Title: They works for now.
Reviews.Author: Valeriy Tolkov
Reviews.Content: I've purchased them to replace failing drives. They have saved my data and work fine. Don't know what can I say more.

Reviews.Title: Good RAID drive
Reviews.Author: Jo Osborne
Reviews.Content: I will be using this drive to fill out a 6 drive RAID 10 configuration on my home file server.  WD product quality is not what it was 10 years ago, but WD is still (in my opinion) the best of the SATA hard drives.  Tests posted below run on a Gigabyte P67 MB with Intel 2600K I7 CPU, 32GB memory.HD Tune benchmarksMinimum: 64.6 MB/sMaximum: 113.3 MB/sAccess time: 16.2 msBurst rate: 94.4 MB/sCPU usage: 7.8%One negative comment on Amazon shipping policy.  If you choose Super Saver (free) shipping, your order will not ship for 3-7 days.  Amazon rep says they hold the order until several free shipping orders are ready to ship and then ship all of them at once.  Other internet retailers (Buy.com, Newegg.com) will ship immediately.  If you need it fast from Amazon, either buy elsewhere or pay for faster shipping.

Reviews.Title: Disappears from Server System - Requires Newer Controllers
Reviews.Author: MissingNoFingers
Reviews.Content: When used with a 34xx/54xx/58xx Adaptec SATA RAID controller, this model of drive may disappear from the system and go offline.  Consistent testing shows this western digital wdc drive will fail and the problem can be replicated at will, however, installing older WDC models (RE3, RE2, RE drives) will not fail, so seems to be an issue with the new RE4 firmware on this new drive.  Tried multiple WD1003FBYX drives - all with the same disappearing act.  A Search for "wdc drive disappears from system" will show you numerous people reporting these type of issues. It has been suggested that this is due to firmware of the drive and it's speed control, which western digital has released a fix for others that had a similar issue as this one. I will add that I believe WDC drives are the best on the market though, so this matter is limited to this drive and specific types of systems. You may not experience the problem.Update: 11/07/2012 - As it turns out, this drive is not compatible with some of the older RAID controllers and found several systems this would consistently fail on using Adaptec 3405. As it so happens, replacing this drive with an older model resolved the issue.

Reviews.Title: Great product; great price
Reviews.Author: Rw Scolari "navy689"
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement drvie for an older, smaller, slower Western Digital drive.  As prices drop, capacities increase the black series of WD drives leads the pack.

Reviews.Title: Faaast drive!
Reviews.Author: L. Iacono "Jungle"
Reviews.Content: The fastest drive on the market with a motor. It works great for video projects and music production. This unit is more expensive than all other drives in its class, but for a reason.

Reviews.Title: great hdd for enterprise service
Reviews.Author: Jesus Gonzalez-Brey
Reviews.Content: work as expected very fast for a mechanical drive no cons ask me again when they have been in service for a few years.

Reviews.Title: Review
Reviews.Author: JMan 31337
Reviews.Content: Had to send the first drive back because had way to many bad sectors. You think they would have better quality tests. Other then that it is a good drive.

Reviews.Title: As expected
Reviews.Author: William S. Phelps
Reviews.Content: This hard drive is exactly what I required and expected.  It is fast, quiet and dependable.  It is in no way lacking and in no way exceptional.  The price is right.

Reviews.Title: Abnoxiously LOUD!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Puglisi "Savgrace"
Reviews.Content: I seriously regret not returning this drive within the 30 days.  I ran performance and drive integrity texts in Ubuntu and the drive had no problem passing all tests in the green.However, I would only recommend this drive to anyone who has it isolated within a server room or in a sound proof box! You can't even think straight if you use this as your primary drive as every single access sounds like the ancient MB drives from the 80's!  LOUD LOUD LOUD!  Crunch, Grind!I'd think the think was going to fall apart if it didn't pass all tests!  First and LAST WD drive I'll ever buy! Stick with Seagate or Samsung... or go Solid State!

Reviews.Title: good appliance for small business without IT dept
Reviews.Author: Michael Robinson
Reviews.Content: As a small business owner with pretty good computer skills I found it easy to set up and implement. I bought it as a cost saving measure since all I wanted was good, reliable file sharing, and remote access to my files and desktop computers. I think the WD has filled the need just fine. It got me out of the more complicated domain management business. It will save me thousands of $ over the next few years. I did go ahead and buy an extra drive and power supply to have on hand. I figured it was a small price to pay for that extra layer of dependability and backup.

Reviews.Title: For a Friend
Reviews.Author: Ramkiller1
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my brother. A bit expensive but he never complained. Seems to be working perfectly. Good Product, just a bit expensive. Good Shipping. Thanks amazon.

Reviews.Title: Fast and reliable so far
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Many people purchase this drive because it implements WD's TLER, which is supposed to reduce the chance of a drive dropping out of a RAID array, however their main motive for purchasing the RE series is the better warranty and higher MTBF.Most NAS manufacturers will actually ignore TLER (and other implementations from different manufacturers) completely, but it's not a bad thing to have more than you need!Great drives from the cost and with RAID, a cheaper and higher capacity alternative to SSD (though still not quite as fast in most cases).

Reviews.Title: Coffee Pot Loud, but has a 5 Year warranty Good Speed
Reviews.Author: FLY 4 God "flyingbroker"
Reviews.Content: Coffe Pot Loud as another review says, way to loud for a single office, I mean all I hard was purk LKL  u lkhlhkljh  latting, it drove me crazy, speed and performance was good but for the it wasnt worth the extra $

Reviews.Title: Works flawlessly so far
Reviews.Author: Mainsil
Reviews.Content: Both drives work fine, but it only gets 4 stars because I have only had them a few weeks.I would buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Failed in 3 months
Reviews.Author: Curtis Rihn
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money just get the Seagate Barracuda for a third the price.  Bought 3 for a RAID 5 configuration.  3 months later one already failed.  Enterprise grade my a@$.

Reviews.Title: Strong and fast .
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: Not too much to say but the drives were shipped fast and were packet very well. Drives are working great with my Linux OS's ... Make the Linux run even faster ... I don't know how they work on Windows because why pay for a slow OS that freeze up with codes flying all around ...  VictorLinux is my main OS and they made a different...  Ya now the wife wants a Linux OS in her machine with RE-4 HD's.... I told her to pick one out of the FREE Hundred OS's from Linux..RE-4 is as fast as the new Western Digital Bare Drives 250 GB VelociRaptor SATA III 10,000 RPM 64 MB Cache Bulk/OEM Enterprise Hard Drive  I just got... All I can say for the VelocRaptor is that I have one ...

Reviews.Title: WD RE 500 GB Enterprize Hard Drive
Reviews.Author: robert
Reviews.Content: This purchase has been great and years in the making, I only got started in computers in 2007 and never owned one myself that is until the aforementioned year 2007. Sadly I fount out that kids are learning computers and mild programing in grade school 4or 5 years of age. What can tell ya,I was a late bloomer or that I was a working poor person. Now  i am building my own computer it is just great it does take for me proper research and most important staying focused. This hard drive is great exactly what i wanted. Sadly T-Pol did not come with it, it is an ENTERPRIZE hard drive HA HA. I will have to visit her watching the DVD's Enterprize.

Reviews.Title: Western Digital RE4
Reviews.Author: Grizly8745
Reviews.Content: I bought this based on the need to increase speed of data.  After reading the reviews that described this as "speedy" and "fast" I went ahead and made the purchase.First, it really isn't any faster than the Western Digital hard drive with the same capacity (2 years old) that I have now.  Second, I used the Western Digital version of Acronis to clone the system (Windows 7 Pro) and it did not perform as well as when I used it a couple of years ago with Windows XP when I did a new build. It missed some files and the cloned system was very unstable.  I went to a couple of forums and some people couldn't get Acronis to work with Windows 7 at all.  In the end I reinstalled my old hard drive and will keep this one for a spare.I suppose that as far as the speediness that is mostly my fault - I know better and should of checked the specs closer.  The one saving grace about this is I was going to buy the full version of Acronis, but after this experience I'm going to wait until they get the bugs worked out for Windows 7.

Reviews.Title: Fial
Reviews.Author: Tom Kelly
Reviews.Content: I've been a fan of WD until this year. I have 10 of these units + 2 10,000 rpm units. This one was dead on arrival. would not spin up. Sent it back. WD also would not fix my webtv unit..even though they knew it was a design flaw.. THEY KNOW THERE IS COMPETITION. But bottom line comes first. It's time to move on..

Reviews.Title: Not what I needed
Reviews.Author: sally
Reviews.Content: I ordered the hard drive at the recommendation of my computer guru; but it wasn't exactly what I needed but he could use it and traded with me for one that fit my needs.  Thanks, anyway

Reviews.Title: good service
Reviews.Author: Deborah
Reviews.Content: No Problems and a timely delivery everything seemed ok and i quess that is it as i dont have much more to say

Reviews.Title: NOT FOR HOUSE COMPUTER
Reviews.Author: MKRD.info
Reviews.Content: These drives are not for house computers. 2 drives in a row (in several months) show bad sectors and write errors. I had to shift my data two times. I am not buying a HD that claims to be "super reliable" again. Go with Caviar Blue and forget about going for "high performance drives". All they do is fail.Do not trust your data to this drive in a house environment. Get an external Caviar Green based hard drive to store your files on. Do not place your files with windoza partition.I looked at the PCB of this hard drive, and it looks exactly the same as that of a Caviar Green drive. That "two processors" blah blah blah is bs. These drives use almost all of the same parts as the much cheaper Caviar Blue drives. You are overpaying for a drive which is pushed beyond its reliability limits.It is just too bad Caviar Blue or Black HDs for my capacity do not come with 64MB cache. The cache, and the "super reliable" claims were the original reasons I bought these expensive pieces of junk.

ProductInfo.Features:
Ships in Certified Frustration-Free Packaging
Ideal for servers, video surveillance, and other demanding write-intensive applications,
Dual processor - With double the processing power, WD RE4 boasts the highest performance of any drive in the WD RE family.
Each drive is put through extended burn-in testing with thermal cycling to ensure reliable operation.
RAID-specific, time-limited error recovery (TLER) - Prevents drive fallout caused by the extended hard drive error-recovery processes
5 Year limited warranty.
WD RE4 7200 RPM Enterprise SATA hard drives offer capacities up to 2 TB, 64 MB cache, and 4th generation vibration tolerance.
ProductInfo.Name: WD RE4 1 TB Enterprise Hard Drive: 3.5 Inch, 7200 RPM, SATA II, 64 MB Cache - WD1003FBYX
